alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 11:07PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Custer County through 1145 PM CDT... At 1106 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rockville to 7 miles northeast of Miller to 8 miles south of Eddyville. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ansley, Mason City, Block Hill Basin, Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Gavin Siding, Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road, Cumro and Burr Oak. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 73 and 94. Highway 2 between mile markers 293 and 307. Highway 92 between mile markers 300 and 308. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
